meanings.definition: The curve assumed by a cord of uniform density and cross section, hanging freely from two fixed points.
meanings.sent1: The catenary of the rope between the two poles was a beautiful curve.
meanings.sent2: The bridge's design incorporated the elegant catenary shape for support.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the catenary of the clothesline to swing to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed a catenary of happiness across her face.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight created a shimmering catenary on the still lake surface.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the curve assumed by a cord of uniform density and cross section, hanging freely from two fixed points.
meanings.sent1: The catenary design of the bridge provided both strength and beauty.
meanings.sent2: The catenary equation helped calculate the optimal shape for the hanging cable.
meanings.sent3: The catenary pattern on the fabric added a unique touch to the dress.
meanings.sent4: His catenary thoughts always led him to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The catenary arches of the cathedral created a sense of grandeur and awe.
